docs.snippet: A diplomatic crisis tearing at the Middle East has ignited a multimillion-dollar battle for influence in Washington between bitter rivals Qatar and the United Arab Emirates.

headline.print_headline: Qatar, UAE Spend Heavily on Lobbyists Amid a War of Words
headline.main: Qatar, UAE Spend Heavily on Lobbyists Amid a War of Words

docs.snippet: Despite advances the country has made since the Rev. Martin Luther King. Jr. was slain while fighting poverty and racism, "the age of bullies and bigots is not fully behind us," former U.S. Attorney General Eric Holder said Monday.

headline.print_headline: Holder at MLK Event: Age of Bullies, Bigots Not Fully Over
headline.main: Holder at MLK Event: Age of Bullies, Bigots Not Fully Over

docs.snippet: Mexican left-wing presidential candidate Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador has an 18-point lead ahead of the July 1 election, according to a poll published on Monday that showed him with a growing advantage at the start of formal campaigning.

headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Mexican Leftist Has 18-Point Lead as Campaign Kicks Off-Poll
headline.main: Exclusive: Mexican Leftist Has 18-Point Lead as Campaign Kicks Off-Poll

docs.snippet: President Trump has responded to Russia’s ramped-up nuclear arsenal and cyberweapons with a mix of Cold War-era approaches and virtual silence.

headline.print_headline: A Russian Threat on Two Fronts Meets a U.S. Strategic Void
headline.main: A Russian Threat on Two Fronts Meets an American Strategic Void

headline.print_headline: U.S. Seeks China Trade Moves on Autos, Financials, Chips: Source

headline.main: Wall Street Closes Higher as S&P Rises Above Key Support Level

docs.snippet: A Guatemalan immigrant who entered a New York City church to seek refuge from immigration authorities said Thursday she will fight to prevent being separated from her children.

headline.print_headline: Immigrant Mother Hiding in NY Sanctuary Church Vows to Stay
headline.main: Immigrant Mother Hiding in NY Sanctuary Church Vows to Stay

docs.snippet: Marcus Molinaro, the Dutchess County executive, was elected mayor of his Hudson River village at age 19. Now he wants to replace Andrew M. Cuomo as governor.

headline.print_headline: Marcus Molinaro, a Republican With Small-Town Roots, Begins a Run for Governor
headline.main: A Republican With Small-Town Roots Launches Bid for Governor

headline.print_headline: Pentagon Silent on Transgender Policy Released Last Week
headline.main: Pentagon Silent on Transgender Policy Released Last Week

docs.snippet: The United States has flouted trade rules with an inquiry into intellectual property and China will defend its interests, Vice Premier Liu He told U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin in a telephone call on Saturday, Chinese state media reported...
